Hi all,

I found this musuem site that has a lot of tsuba
pictured and I never had been to.  However they have
this 17th Akasaka tsuba pictured that has a gold
inlay.  I didn't think that akasaka worked with
inlays?  Is this just uncommon or wrong?
http://www.beloit.edu/~museum/wrightonline/exhibit6/e60012a.htm

Site is worth going through, some nice pieces,
begining of tsuba section:
http://www.beloit.edu/~museum/wrightonline/exhibit6/e60001a.htm

Thanks
Ken "the mantis dude"
